intro: Synaedrys brevicaudata var. pinnativena, commonly known as the narrow-tailed synaedrys, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology. It features finely divided, pinnate leaves that give it a feathery appearance, which is a key botanical trait. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, tropical environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique leaf structure and its role in local ecosystems.
